publicationStmt.publisher: Centre for Computing in the Humanities, King's College London

address.addrLine: Strand, London WC2R 2LS, England, United Kingdom. Tel:+44 (0) 20 7836 5454

availability.p: This resource is publicly available and free at the point of access and it is registered under a a Creative Commons license Attribution-Share Alike 3.0

sourceDesc.p: No source: created in electronic format.

encodingDesc.p: Encoding according to the CCH TEI Guidelines at http://www.cch.kcl.ac.uk/xmod/about/encoding/

div.p: Design, construction and implementation of the Schenker Documents Online digital environment has been carried out by the following research personnel:

div.head: Centre for Computing in the Humanities, King's College London:

xmt:uList.item: Gerhard Brey : programming support for conversion from MovableType
Paul Caton: lead analyst 2010 (XML/TEI encoding, publication framework, XSLT design)
John Lee: programming support for EATS
Eleonora Litta Modignani Picozzi : support analyst
Tamara Lopez : lead analyst 2007-09 (XML/TEI encoding model, metadata interface design, MT conversion)
Jamie Norrish: EATS (Entity Authority Tool Set) development work
Paul Vetch : visual design, server infrastructure
José Miguel Vieira : web application development

div.head: Universität für Musik und darstellende Kunst, Vienna:

xmt:uList.item: Iby Jolande-Varga : XML encoding of diaries
